Description: Sherd of Fikellura pottery oinochoe consisting of part of rim, neck, and shoulder; white slip; neck glazed inside, rest reserved; exterior: black on rim; on neck, maeander and square frieze; tongues at top of shoulder, every fourth or fifth as preserved with added red; shoulder below reserved as far as preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 123-5, Nau 86, pl. 19c-d)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 242)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 3 R. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.104)
